revision.text: {{talkheader}} {{ArticleHistory|action1=GAN |action1date=July 11 2007 |action1result=Listed |action1oldid=143278477 |action2=FAC |action2date=21:28, 30 August 2007 |action2link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Victoria Cross for New Zealand |action2result=promoted |action2oldid=154575294 |action3=FTC |action3date=5 September 2007 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Victoria Cross |action3result=promoted |action3oldid=154692403 |ftname=Victoria Cross |topic=Socsci |currentstatus=FA |maindate=May 12, 2009 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Orders, Decorations, and Medals|class=FA|importance=high}} {{WikiProject Military history|class=FA|ANZSP=y |Culture-traditions-and-heraldry-task-force=yes}} {{WikiProject New Zealand|class=FA|importance=high}} }} == Proposing Move == I suggest that this page be moved to [[Victoria Cross for New Zealand]], which currently redirects here. The full name of the award this page is about is the '''Victoria Cross for New Zealand'''. [[Victoria Cross (New Zealand)]] might be an appropriate title for a page about the awards of Victoria Crosses to New Zealanders, but that is not what this page is about. Thoughts? Comments? Objections? [[User:Quadparty|Quadparty]] 02:02, 2 July 2007 (UTC) :I agree, i think you should move the page as and when you can. [[User:Woodym555|Woodym555]] 06:49, 2 July 2007 (UTC) ::Good suggestion - given that we seem to have a significant degree of support (and given the sound rationale of the suggestion), I have made the move. ::[[User:Xdamr|Xdamr]][[User_Talk:Xdamr|talk]] 13:24, 2 July 2007 (UTC) == GA Nomination == == Successful [[Wikipedia:Good articles|good article]] nomination == I am glad to say that this article which was nominated for [[WP:GA|good article]] status has succeeded. This is how the article, as of July 11, 2007, compares against the [[Wikipedia:What is a good article?|six good article criteria]]: :'''1. Well written?:''' The best GAN I reviewed :'''2. Factually accurate?:''' I know a little about the subject :'''3. Broad in coverage?:''' Covers all major aspects. :'''4. Neutral point of view?:''' I've seen no bias :'''5. Article stability?''' History shows no recent edit war :'''6. Images?:''' Nice images. If you feel that this review is in error, feel free to take it to a [[WP:GA/R|GA review]]. Thank you to all of the editors who worked hard to bring it to this status. — -[[User:Flubeca|Flubeca]][[User talk:Flubeca|Talk]] 21:27, 11 July 2007 (UTC) == Maker == Do we know who made the first medal? Was it the same outfit that has made all the Imperial VCs? [[User:Albatross2147|Albatross2147]] ([[User talk:Albatross2147|talk]]) 20:51, 25 April 2008 (UTC) :Yes, it is still made from the gunmetal captured during the Crimean War and it is made by [[Hancocks]]. I have made this clear in the article now. [[User:Woody|Woody]] ([[User talk:Woody|talk]]) 21:00, 25 April 2008 (UTC) == How many New Zealanders? == The lead section says the original VC has been awarded 23 times to 22 individuals and the awarding the medal section says 21 times, yet the link to the [[List of Victoria Cross recipients by nationality]] shows 25 awards to 24 individuals. Presumably the list is correct and the two sections here need to be amended. --[[User:DavidCane|DavidCane]] ([[User talk:DavidCane|talk]]) 21:46, 24 September 2008 (UTC) :I suspect different sources may give different answers as there are a few with dual nationality and so on. But we should at least be consistent, and footnote any quibbles. [[User:David Underdown|David Underdown]] ([[User talk:David Underdown|talk]]) 08:27, 25 September 2008 (UTC) ::On further investigation, I suspect Freyberg and William Sanders weren't being counted as this article also said that only 11 were awarded in WWI, whereas the list gives 13. I think I 've straightened this out now. [[User:David Underdown|David Underdown]] ([[User talk:David Underdown|talk]]) 09:31, 25 September 2008 (UTC) == Sale of medal == The lead says "Due to its rarity, the VC is highly prized and the medal has been sold for over £200,000 at auction." Is this referring to the NZ-VC (of which there's only one, so of course it's rare) or VCs in general? If it refers to the one and only NZ-VC, surely this should be made clear: if not, the ambiguity should be removed, as this is not an article about VCs in general. [[User:Physchim62|Physchim62]] [[User talk:Physchim62|(talk)]] 00:20, 12 May 2009 (UTC) :I just made much the same comment about the Main Page blurb. I note the [[Victoria Cross]] article has the exact same wording (except it says £400,000 and it has a source), and the [[Bill Apiata]] article says he donated his NZVC to New Zealand, so I agree this needs to be clarified, or removed as inapplicable. I'm going to be bold and remove it, feel free to revert if you want to discuss. --[[User:Floquenbeam|Floquenbeam]] ([[User talk:Floquenbeam|talk]]) 00:41, 12 May 2009 (UTC) == Metal == The sentence on the true origin of the metal was rather confusing/misleading since it appeared to be a misreading of the sources. I've tried to improve it here [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Victoria_Cross_for_New_Zealand&diff=289435036&oldid=289428474]. My understanding from the 3 sources particularly the Guardian one is that the X-rays have little to do with establishing the origin of the cannons. The X-rays simply showed that the earlier medals were made from metal originating from a different source which is significant since amongst other reasons it's sometimes claimed all VCs were made from this metal. This isn't particularly relevant to this article (since the one and only VCNZ was made from this metal) so IMHO is not necessary. The reason it's known the cannons are Chinese isn't clearly stated but my assumption is the design etc make it obvious the cannons are Chinese not Russian. Finally while one of the sources uses the word antique, I think that's best left out. My understanding from the Guardian source is that it's still theoretically possible these cannons were use Sebastopol but there's no evidence for this so it seems unlikely. Saying they are antique in the current context seems to me to imply they are significantly older then Sebastopol and therefore could not have been used there but that doesn't seem to be the case. Any further working on the wording is welcome but I think careful reading of the sources is needed to ensure we actually say what the sources are saying. [[User:Nil Einne|Nil Einne]] ([[User talk:Nil Einne|talk]]) 10:22, 12 May 2009 (UTC) == Precedence == Does either the warrant for the VC for NZ or the NZ Order of Wear state that the VC for NZ have equivalent precedence? [[User:Anthony Staunton|Anthony Staunton]] ([[User talk:Anthony Staunton|talk]]) 02:08, 6 January 2013 (UTC)
